body:
Comment 4 by **ravenstone13@cox.net**: 
I'd have to vote for leaving it alone. Two reasons: 
1) All the cases mentioned so far can be trivially added as functions (or could be
done with a preprocessor - but that's a different issue)
2) While it may seem 'odd' now to see m[k] = nil, false - It is good to remind
oneself that at one time it was odd to see a language with an idiom like 'x += 10' (I
started coding in Fortran II).  We (the programmers) will get used to the new idioms.
